description_i18n.en: This section includes temporal and coordinate identifiers. It contains all the required information to uniquely identify a point on the earth surface. It also defines the transformations and conversions parameters to convert from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to another. This metadata entity includes the parameters specifying the geospatial references that relate information represented in the data (features) to their geographic space. The considered reference system is only based on coordinates and not on geographic identifiers.

___meReferenceSystem.description: This section includes temporal and coordinate identifiers. It contains all the required information to uniquely identify a point on the earth surface. It also defines the transformations and conversions parameters to convert from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to another. This metadata entity includes the parameters specifying the geospatial references that relate information represented in the data (features) to their geographic space. The considered reference system is only based on coordinates and not on geographic identifiers.
___meReferenceSystem.title: REFERENCE SYSTEM

description_i18n.en: Identifier of the projection used.
Name of the projection used contains the set of parameters that describe the projection.

description_i18n.en: This section contains the set of parameters that describe the projection.

___seProjectionParameters.description: This section contains the set of parameters that describe the projection.
___seProjectionParameters.title: PROJECTION PARAMETERS

description_i18n.en: Value added to all 'y' values to the coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. It is expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinates Units.

___falseNorthing.description: Value added to all 'y' values to the coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. It is expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinates Units.
___falseNorthing.title: False northing

description_i18n.en: Multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance at the projection origin.

___scaleFactorAtProjectionOrigin.description: Multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance at the projection origin.
___scaleFactorAtProjectionOrigin.title: Scale factor at projection origin

description_i18n.en: Ratio between distance on earth and the corresponding map distance, along the center line.

___scaleFactorAtCenterLine.description: Ratio between distance on earth and the corresponding map distance, along the center line.
___scaleFactorAtCenterLine.title: Scale factor at center line

description_i18n.en: Ratio between the distance on earth and the corresponding map distance, along the equator.

___scaleFactorAtEquator.description: Ratio between the distance on earth and the corresponding map distance, along the equator.
___scaleFactorAtEquator.title: Scale factor at the equator

description_i18n.en: Line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

___longitudeOfCentralMeridian.description: Line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.
___longitudeOfCentralMeridian.title: Longitude of central meridian

description_i18n.en: Unique identifier for 100,000-meter grid zone.

___heightOfProspectivePointAboveSurface.title: Height of view point above the Earth (m)

description_i18n.en: Latitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

___latitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: Latitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.
___latitudeOfProjectionCenter.title: Latitude of projection center

description_i18n.en: Latitude chosen as the origin of the coordinates for a map projection.

___latitudeOfProjectionOrigin.description: Latitude chosen as the origin of the coordinates for a map projection.
___latitudeOfProjectionOrigin.title: Latitude of projection origin

description_i18n.en: Method used to describe the line along which an oblique Mercator map projection is centred using the map projection origin and an azimuth.

___seObliqueLineAzimuth.description: Method used to describe the line along which an oblique Mercator map projection is centred using the map projection origin and an azimuth.
___seObliqueLineAzimuth.title: Oblique Line Azimuth

description_i18n.en: Measure clockwise from north and express in degree of the angle.

___azimuthAngle.description: Measure clockwise from north and express in degree of the angle.
___azimuthAngle.title: Azimuth angle

title_i18n.en: Longitude of the map projection origin

description_i18n.en: Longitude of the origin in the map projection.

___azimuthMeasurePointLongitude.description: Longitude of the origin in the map projection.
___azimuthMeasurePointLongitude.title: Longitude of the map projection origin

description_i18n.en: Longitude to be oriented straight up from the North Pole.

___straightVerticalLongitudeFromPole.description: Longitude to be oriented straight up from the North Pole.
___straightVerticalLongitudeFromPole.title: Straight vertical longitude from pole

description_i18n.en: Value added to all 'x' values to the coordinates for a map projection. It is expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Unit.

___falseEasting.description: Value added to all 'x' values to the coordinates for a map projection. It is expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Unit.
___falseEasting.title: False easting

description_i18n.en: Line of constant latitude where the projection surface intersects the earth.

___standardParallel.description: Line of constant latitude where the projection surface intersects the earth.
___standardParallel.title: Standard parallel

title_i18n.en: Unit of measure of false easting/northing

description_i18n.en: Unit of the falseEasting and falseNorthing.

___falseEastingNorthingUnits.description: Unit of the falseEasting and falseNorthing.
___falseEastingNorthingUnits.title: Unit of measure of false easting/northing

description_i18n.en: Method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centred using two points near the limit of the mapped region that define the centre line.

___seObliqueLinePoint.description: Method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centred using two points near the limit of the mapped region that define the centre line.
___seObliqueLinePoint.title: Oblique Line Point

description_i18n.en: Latitude of a point defining the oblique line.

___obliqueLineLatitude.description: Latitude of a point defining the oblique line.
___obliqueLineLatitude.title: Oblique line latitude

description_i18n.en: Longitude of a point defining the oblique line.

___obliqueLineLongitude.description: Longitude of a point defining the oblique line.
___obliqueLineLongitude.title: Oblique line longitude

description_i18n.en: Longitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

___longitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: Longitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.
___longitudeOfProjectionCenter.title: Longitude of projection centre

description_i18n.en: This section provides the identifiers of the datum of the considered Coordinate Reference System (CRS).

___seDatum.description: This section provides the identifiers of the datum of the considered Coordinate Reference System (CRS).
___seDatum.title: Datum

description_i18n.en: Identifier of the datum used. Datum description is requested when the coordinate reference system citation is not supplied. A datum could be geodetic, vertical or engineering. A geodetic datum gives the relationship of a coordinate system to the Earth and is used as the basis for two or three dimensional system (in most cases it requires an ellipsoid definition). A vertical datum gives the relationship of gravity-related heights to a surface known as the geoid. A datum can be engineering if it is neither geodetic not vertical. For geodetic datum it could be useful to report the EPGS (European Petroleum Survey Group) coordinates.

___datum.description: Identifier of the datum used. Datum description is requested when the coordinate reference system citation is not supplied. A datum could be geodetic, vertical or engineering. A geodetic datum gives the relationship of a coordinate system to the Earth and is used as the basis for two or three dimensional system (in most cases it requires an ellipsoid definition). A vertical datum gives the relationship of gravity-related heights to a surface known as the geoid. A datum can be engineering if it is neither geodetic not vertical. For geodetic datum it could be useful to report the EPGS (European Petroleum Survey Group) coordinates.
___datum.title: Datum

description_i18n.en: Name of the datum used.
Identifier of the reference system. One of the most common standards for reference systems is the EPSG Geodetic Parameter Registry, created by the European Petroleum Survey Group.

___referenceSystemIdentifier.description: Identifier of the reference system. One of the most common standards for reference systems is the EPSG Geodetic Parameter Registry, created by the European Petroleum Survey Group.
___referenceSystemIdentifier.title: Identifier of reference system

description_i18n.en: This section provides the identifiers of the ellipsoid of the considered Coordinate Reference System (CRS).

___seEllipsoid.description: This section provides the identifiers of the ellipsoid of the considered Coordinate Reference System (CRS).
___seEllipsoid.title: Ellipsoid

description_i18n.en: Set of parameters that describe the ellipsoid.

___seEllipsoidParameters.description: Set of parameters that describe the ellipsoid.
___seEllipsoidParameters.title: Ellipsoid Parameters

description_i18n.en: Measure of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid.

___semiMajorAxis.description: Measure of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid.
___semiMajorAxis.title: Semi major axis

description_i18n.en: Ratio between the semi-major axis and the semi-minor axis of an ellipse. Generally an ellipse is completely specified by the measure of the semi-major axis 'a' and the measure of the semi-minor axis 'b'.

___denominatorOfFlatteringRatio.description: Ratio between the semi-major axis and the semi-minor axis of an ellipse. Generally an ellipse is completely specified by the measure of the semi-major axis 'a' and the measure of the semi-minor axis 'b'.
___denominatorOfFlatteringRatio.title: Deniminator of flattening rate

description_i18n.en: Units of the semi-major axis.
Name of the ellipsoid used.
Identifier of the ellipsoid used.
Alias or the name of the reference system.

___referenceSystemName.description: Alias or the name of the reference system.
___referenceSystemName.title: Extented name of reference system

description_i18n.en: Responsible party that could be identify as the data source. FENIX metadata contains more than one field of the type 'ResponsibleParty' addressed to report all the information necessary to contact party(ies) playing different roles in respect to the resource. In particular this field (belonging to the Identification entity) should report the party who owns authority on the resource.

FENIX metadata contains more than one field of the type 'ResponsibleParty' addressed to report all the information necessary to contact party(ies) playing different roles in respect to the resource. ___contacts.title: Contact(s)

description_i18n.en: This section includes information about the mechanism to represent spatial information both in raster and vector formats. It includes concepts for describing and manipulating the spatial characteristics of geographic features. This metadata entity is only valid for geospatial resources like vector and raster layers or TINs. Depending on the value assumed by its resourceRepresentationType element, it extends to GridSpatialRepresentation entity (for resourceRepresentationType = 'raster') or VectorSpatialRepresentation (for resourceRepresentationType = 'vector' or 'tin').

___meSpatialRepresentation.description: This section includes information about the mechanism to represent spatial information both in raster and vector formats. It includes concepts for describing and manipulating the spatial characteristics of geographic features. This metadata entity is only valid for geospatial resources like vector and raster layers or TINs. Depending on the value assumed by its resourceRepresentationType element, it extends to GridSpatialRepresentation entity (for resourceRepresentationType = 'raster') or VectorSpatialRepresentation (for resourceRepresentationType = 'vector' or 'tin').
___meSpatialRepresentation.title: SPATIAL REPRESENTATION

___processing.description: Analytical method used to process the geographic dataset.
___processing.title: Processing

___typeOfProduct.description: Coded information about the product managed.
___typeOfProduct.title: Type of product

description_i18n.en: Layer typology: vector or raster spatial representation.

___layerType.description: Layer typology: vector or raster spatial representation.
___layerType.title: Type of layer

description_i18n.en: This section includes the planar measurement units used to express the X,Y values. The bounding box indicates the smaller quadrilateral shape that includes all features of the considered resource.

description_i18n.en: The smaller Y coordinate value delimiting the resource (mandatory.

description_i18n.en: This section reports the parameters about a grid (raster) resource.

description_i18n.en: Reference to the OJ Dimensions object that reports information about spatial-temporal axis properties.

___axisDimensionProperties.description: Reference to the OJ Dimensions object that reports information about spatial-temporal axis properties.
___axisDimensionProperties.title: Information about spatial-temporal axis properties

title_i18n.en: Coordinate of the origin within the cell

description_i18n.en: Whether coordinates of the origin of the raster refer to the center or the corner of the cell of origin.

___xyPosition.description: Whether coordinates of the origin of the raster refer to the center or the corner of the cell of origin.
___xyPosition.title: Coordinate of the origin within the cell

title_i18n.en: Identification of grid data as point or cell

description_i18n.en: Specifies whether each pixel of the raster data represents a point or an area. A raster with the cell geometry as point assumes that the features to represent, or the values to report, refers to the center of the cell; cell geometry as area represents the whole area covered by the cell (e.g. averages of values falling within the cell; dominant feature of the cell, etc.).

___cellGeometry.description: Specifies whether each pixel of the raster data represents a point or an area. A raster with the cell geometry as point assumes that the features to represent, or the values to report, refers to the center of the cell; cell geometry as area represents the whole area covered by the cell (e.g. averages of values falling within the cell; dominant feature of the cell, etc.).
___cellGeometry.title: Identification of grid data as point or cell

description_i18n.en: Number of independent spatial-temporal axes. For ex-ample, a grid dataset representing the topography of an area has 3 dimensions: x, y for the planar representation of the area and z reporting the elevation value of each cell.

___numberOfDimensions.description: Number of independent spatial-temporal axes. For ex-ample, a grid dataset representing the topography of an area has 3 dimensions: x, y for the planar representation of the area and z reporting the elevation value of each cell.
___numberOfDimensions.title: Number of dimension

description_i18n.en: Origin of the raster is the lower left or the upper left cell.

___cellOfOrigin.description: Origin of the raster is the lower left or the upper left cell.
___cellOfOrigin.title: Origin of raster cell

description_i18n.en: Value assigned to the cells to represent the absence of data.

___noDataValue.description: Value assigned to the cells to represent the absence of data.
___noDataValue.title: Value assigned to No-data

description_i18n.en: This section provides information about the frequency of resource upgrade and metadata maintenance.

description_i18n.en: This section includes the formal set of instructions assigning responsibility as well as the authority to an organization for the collection, processing, and dissemination of statistics.

___meInstitutionalMandate.description: This section includes the formal set of instructions assigning responsibility as well as the authority to an organization for the collection, processing, and dissemination of statistics.

description_i18n.en: References (citations or website link) to arrangements or procedures for data sharing and coordination.

___institutionalMandateDataSharing.description: References (citations or website link) to arrangements or procedures for data sharing and coordination.
___institutionalMandateDataSharing.title: Data sharing arrangements

description_i18n.en: References (citations or website link) to legal acts or other formal or informal agreements that assign responsibility as well as authority to an agency for the collection, processing, and dissemination of the resource.

___legalActsAgreements.description: References (citations or website link) to legal acts or other formal or informal agreements that assign responsibility as well as authority to an agency for the collection, processing, and dissemination of the resource.
___legalActsAgreements.title: Legal acts/agreements

description_i18n.en: This section describes the statistical operations and transformations applied to data. It includes the process used to collect data, the description of raw data and a detailed review of the process used to compute processed resource.

___meStatisticalProcessing.description: This section describes the statistical operations and transformations applied to data. It includes the process used to collect data, the description of raw data and a detailed review of the process used to compute processed resource.
___meStatisticalProcessing.title: STATISTICAL PROCESSING

description_i18n.en: Methods and processes for assessing statistical data. It describes the process of monitoring data compilation progress and ensuring the quality of the statistical results.

___seDataValidation.description: Methods and processes for assessing statistical data. It describes the process of monitoring data compilation progress and ensuring the quality of the statistical results.
___seDataValidation.title: Data Validation

description_i18n.en: Assessment of discrepancies and/or inaccuracies observed in the statistical outputs.

___dataValidationOutput.description: Assessment of discrepancies and/or inaccuracies observed in the statistical outputs.
___dataValidationOutput.title: Data validation - output

description_i18n.en: Assessment of the quality and correctness of intermediate calculations leading to statistical outputs.

___dataValidationIntermediate.description: Assessment of the quality and correctness of intermediate calculations leading to statistical outputs.
___dataValidationIntermediate.title: Data validation - intermediate

description_i18n.en: Assessment of discrepancies and/or inaccuracies inherent to the data source.

___dataValidationSource.description: Assessment of discrepancies and/or inaccuracies inherent to the data source.
___dataValidationSource.title: Data validation - source

description_i18n.en: Process used to collect data. It includes a detailed description both of the primary data collection (e.g. type of collection, method to gather data from respondents, sampling procedures..) and the secondary data collection (information about data that have been already collected by another agency or institution).

___seDataSource.description: Process used to collect data. It includes a detailed description both of the primary data collection (e.g. type of collection, method to gather data from respondents, sampling procedures..) and the secondary data collection (information about data that have been already collected by another agency or institution).
___seDataSource.title: Data source

description_i18n.en: This section is filled when the agency compiling and publishing data does not coincide with the entity (subject, agency or institution) who has conducted the procedure of collecting data. It reports information about the source that have already collected data.

___seSecondaryDataCollection.description: This section is filled when the agency compiling and publishing data does not coincide with the entity (subject, agency or institution) who has conducted the procedure of collecting data. It reports information about the source that have already collected data.
___seSecondaryDataCollection.title: Secondary Data Collection

title_i18n.es: Descripción de los datos en bruto

description_i18n.en: Characteristics and components of the raw statistical data used for compiling statistical aggregates. It indicates if data set is based on a survey or on administrative data source. If administrative registers are used, the description of registers should be given (source, year, primary purpose, potential deficiencies. . . ).

___rawDataDescription.description: Characteristics and components of the raw statistical data used for compiling statistical aggregates. It indicates if data set is based on a survey or on administrative data source. If administrative registers are used, the description of registers should be given (source, year, primary purpose, potential deficiencies. . . ).
___rawDataDescription.title: Description of raw data

description_i18n.en: Data collection details
Coded element which allows to specify in a standard way the origin of the resource.

___originOfCollectedData.description: Coded element which allows to specify in a standard way the origin of the resource.
___originOfCollectedData.title: Origin of collected data

description_i18n.en: If the element <<originOfCollectedData>> has been generally specified as 'other International Organizations' this element requests to report the exact source of the resource.

___organization.description: If the element <<originOfCollectedData>> has been generally specified as 'other International Organizations' this element requests to report the exact source of the resource.

description_i18n.en: This section describes the procedures used to collect data obtained directly from first-hand sources by means of surveys, observation or experimentation.

description_i18n.en: The entity (individual, agency or institution) responsible for administering the questionnaire or interview or compiling the data.
Addressable subdivision of an organization.
Responsible person-surname, given name, title separated by a delimiter. It contains information about the party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge the resource.

description_i18n.en: Name of the responsible organization.

___specify.description: Textual metadata element that allows to specify the role performed by the responsible party. This field is conditional to the element <role>.

description_i18n.en: Role or position of the responsible person.

___position.title: Position

___dataCollector.description: The entity (individual, agency or institution) responsible for administering the questionnaire or interview or compiling the data.
___dataCollector.title: Data collector

description_i18n.en: Coded element which specifies the type of data collection method (e.g. census, random sampling, etc.).

___typeOfCollection.description: Coded element which specifies the type of data collection method (e.g. census, random sampling, etc.).
___typeOfCollection.title: Type of collection

description_i18n.en: Methods used to gather data from the respondents (e.g. postal survey, CAPI, on-line survey, face-to-face interviews etc.) and description of data collection methods. This metadata element also includes more precise information about the kind of questionnaire (structured, unstructured etc.) and if necessary somenoteworthy aspects of the data collection process.

___dataCollection.description: Methods used to gather data from the respondents (e.g. postal survey, CAPI, on-line survey, face-to-face interviews etc.) and description of data collection methods. This metadata element also includes more precise information about the kind of questionnaire (structured, unstructured etc.) and if necessary somenoteworthy aspects of the data collection process.
___dataCollection.title: Data collection

description_i18n.en: The type of sample design used to select the survey respondents to represent the population. It may refer to information on sample design, sample size, sample frame, sample updating etc.

___samplingProcedure.description: The type of sample design used to select the survey respondents to represent the population. It may refer to information on sample design, sample size, sample frame, sample updating etc.
___samplingProcedure.title: Sampling procedure

description_i18n.en: This section describes the main statistics actions operated on data (e.g. data editing, imputation, weighting, adjustment for non-response, model used etc.).

___seDataCompilation.description: This section describes the main statistics actions operated on data (e.g. data editing, imputation, weighting, adjustment for non-response, model used etc.).
___seDataCompilation.title: Data compilation

description_i18n.en: Description of weights system (if any) used in order to produce accurate statistical results. This field reports the criteria for using weights in analysis of collection, the formulas and coefficients developed and how they are applied to data.

___weights.description: Description of weights system (if any) used in order to produce accurate statistical results. This field reports the criteria for using weights in analysis of collection, the formulas and coefficients developed and how they are applied to data.
___weights.title: Weights

description_i18n.en: Type of index number used in the statistical production process.

___indexType.description: Type of index number used in the statistical production process.
___indexType.title: Type of index

description_i18n.en: Type of adjustment used represented by a code.

___dataAdjustment.description: Type of adjustment used represented by a code.
___dataAdjustment.title: Process of adjustment

description_i18n.en: Information about the methodology used to aggregate data.

___aggregationProcessing.description: Information about the methodology used to aggregate data.
___aggregationProcessing.title: Process of aggregation

description_i18n.en: Period of time used as a base of an index number or to which a time series refers (e.g. base year 2000 for certain annual data).

___basePeriod.description: Period of time used as a base of an index number or to which a time series refers (e.g. base year 2000 for certain annual data).
___basePeriod.title: Base period

description_i18n.en: It describe under which circumstance missing data are estimated or imputed and when the cells are left empty. It also describe methodologies used to estimate/impute missing values.

___missingData.description: It describe under which circumstance missing data are estimated or imputed and when the cells are left empty. It also describe methodologies used to estimate/impute missing values.
___missingData.title: Missing data

description_i18n.en: Formula used to aggregate data.

title_i18n.es: Detalles sobre el proceso de ajuste

description_i18n.en: Set of procedures employed to modify statistical data to enable it to be conform with national or international standards (such as seasonal adjustment methods, time series decomposition, or other similar methods).

___dataAdjustmentDetails.description: Set of procedures employed to modify statistical data to enable it to be conform with national or international standards (such as seasonal adjustment methods, time series decomposition, or other similar methods).
___dataAdjustmentDetails.title: Details on process of adjustment

description_i18n.en: This section provides a description and evaluation of the data quality. It allows to describe the data quality assurance process, inclusive of data validation, completeness and accuracy standards. In addition an assessment of the comparability and intern coherence of the resource is considered a quality dimension.

___meDataQuality.description: This section provides a description and evaluation of the data quality. It allows to describe the data quality assurance process, inclusive of data validation, completeness and accuracy standards. In addition an assessment of the comparability and intern coherence of the resource is considered a quality dimension.
___meDataQuality.title: DATA QUALITY

description_i18n.en: This section describes the policy and practice for identifying the revision status of the data, as well as the availability of revision studies and analysis.

___seDataRevision.description: This section describes the policy and practice for identifying the revision status of the data, as well as the availability of revision studies and analysis.
___seDataRevision.title: Data revision

description_i18n.en: Policy concerning the periodically revision of the resource and ensuring the transparency of disseminated data.

___revisionPolicy.description: Policy concerning the periodically revision of the resource and ensuring the transparency of disseminated data.
___revisionPolicy.title: Revision policy

title_i18n.fr: Pratique de la révision des données

description_i18n.en: Information concerning the revision of data in order to give compilers the possibility of incorporating new and more accurate information in the resource. It also describes the revision status of available data. Data may also be subject to regular or ad hoc revisions as a result of the introduction of new classification, compilation frameworks and methodologies in order to improve the accuracy of the resource.

___revisionPractice.description: Information concerning the revision of data in order to give compilers the possibility of incorporating new and more accurate information in the resource. It also describes the revision status of available data. Data may also be subject to regular or ad hoc revisions as a result of the introduction of new classification, compilation frameworks and methodologies in order to improve the accuracy of the resource.
___revisionPractice.title: Revision practice

description_i18n.en: Evaluation of data-quality through user satisfaction involving also information about the resource-completeness.

___seRelevance.description: Evaluation of data-quality through user satisfaction involving also information about the resource-completeness.
___seRelevance.title: Relevance

description_i18n.en: How the views and opinions of the users are collected. In addition the main results regarding the user satisfaction should be shown (in the form of a user satisfaction index if available) and the date of most recent user satisfaction survey.

___userSatisfaction.description: How the views and opinions of the users are collected. In addition the main results regarding the user satisfaction should be shown (in the form of a user satisfaction index if available) and the date of most recent user satisfaction survey.
___userSatisfaction.title: User satisfaction

description_i18n.en: Classification of users with some indication of their importance, an indication of the uses for which they want the statistical outputs and as well users and uses given special considerations. Unmet user needs and the reasons for not meeting them should be included as well.

___userNeeds.description: Classification of users with some indication of their importance, an indication of the uses for which they want the statistical outputs and as well users and uses given special considerations. Unmet user needs and the reasons for not meeting them should be included as well.
___userNeeds.title: User needs

description_i18n.en: State of completeness of the resource.

___completeness.description: State of completeness of the resource.
___completeness.title: Completeness

description_i18n.en: Percentage of the state of completeness of the resource.

___completenessPercentage.description: Percentage of the state of completeness of the resource.
___completenessPercentage.title: Percentage of completeness

description_i18n.en: Structure, responsibilities and procedures established for guaranteeing the quality of the data.

___qualityManagement.description: Structure, responsibilities and procedures established for guaranteeing the quality of the data.
___qualityManagement.title: Quality management

description_i18n.en: Evaluation of the timeliness of the resource dissemination with respect to the phenomenon it describes. In addition this section take in to account the punctuality of data dissemination.

___seTimelinessPunctuality.description: Evaluation of the timeliness of the resource dissemination with respect to the phenomenon it describes. In addition this section take in to account the punctuality of data dissemination.
___seTimelinessPunctuality.title: Timeliness and Punctuality

description_i18n.en: Time lag between the release date of data and the target date announced in some official release calendar.

___punctuality.description: Time lag between the release date of data and the target date announced in some official release calendar.
___punctuality.title: Punctuality

description_i18n.en: It refers to the speed of data availability, length of time between data availability and the event or phenomenon they describe.

___timeliness.description: It refers to the speed of data availability, length of time between data availability and the event or phenomenon they describe.
___timeliness.title: Timeliness

description_i18n.en: Closeness of computations or estimates to the exact values that the statistics were intended to measure. Accuracy can contain either measures of numerical results of the methods for assessing the accuracy of data or qualitative assessment indicators. It may also be described in terms of the major sources of error that potentially cause inaccuracy (e.g. sampling, non-response, response error).

___seAccuracy.description: Closeness of computations or estimates to the exact values that the statistics were intended to measure. Accuracy can contain either measures of numerical results of the methods for assessing the accuracy of data or qualitative assessment indicators. It may also be described in terms of the major sources of error that potentially cause inaccuracy (e.g. sampling, non-response, response error).
___seAccuracy.title: Accuracy

description_i18n.en: If probability sampling is used, the accuracy is an evaluation of difference between a population value and an estimate thereof, derived from a random sample (so due to the fact that only a subset of the population is enumerate), normally in the form of coefficient of variation, standard error or confidence intervals. For non-probability sampling, random errors cannot be calculated without reference to some kind of model, in this case estimates of the accuracy, a motivation for the invoked model for this estimation and brief discussion of sampling bias should be provided.

___accuracySampling.description: If probability sampling is used, the accuracy is an evaluation of difference between a population value and an estimate thereof, derived from a random sample (so due to the fact that only a subset of the population is enumerate), normally in the form of coefficient of variation, standard error or confidence intervals. For non-probability sampling, random errors cannot be calculated without reference to some kind of model, in this case estimates of the accuracy, a motivation for the invoked model for this estimation and brief discussion of sampling bias should be provided.
___accuracySampling.title: Accuracy - sampling error

title_i18n.fr: Précision - erreur pas due au échantillonnage

description_i18n.en: Error in sample estimates which cannot be attributed to sampling fluctuations. (e.g. defects in the sampling frame, faulty demarcation of sample units, defects in the selection of sample units, mistakes in the collection of data due to personal variations, misunderstanding, bias, negligence . . . etc.)

___accuracyNonSampling.description: Error in sample estimates which cannot be attributed to sampling fluctuations. (e.g. defects in the sampling frame, faulty demarcation of sample units, defects in the selection of sample units, mistakes in the collection of data due to personal variations, misunderstanding, bias, negligence . . . etc.)
___accuracyNonSampling.title: Accuracy - non sampling error

description_i18n.en: Description of the process assuring that the data production processes conforms to the statistical quality standards.

___qualityAssurance.description: Description of the process assuring that the data production processes conforms to the statistical quality standards.
___qualityAssurance.title: Quality assurance

title_i18n.fr: Évaluation de la qualité des données
title_i18n.es: Evaluación de la calidad de datos

description_i18n.en: Overall qualitative assessment of the quality of the statistical outputs.

___qualityAssessment.description: Overall qualitative assessment of the quality of the statistical outputs.
___qualityAssessment.title: Data quality assessment

description_i18n.en: Degree of data comparability across the geographic areas or regions referenced by the resource. Data might be derived from surveys that in general are conducted by different statistical agencies. These surveys often refer to populations of different geographical areas, sometimes based on different methodologies.

___seComparability.description: Degree of data comparability across the geographic areas or regions referenced by the resource. Data might be derived from surveys that in general are conducted by different statistical agencies. These surveys often refer to populations of different geographical areas, sometimes based on different methodologies.
___seComparability.title: Comparability Coherence

description_i18n.en: Extent to which data are comparable or reconcilable over time. It refers to the degree of comparability between the measures of a time series (e.g. related to a country, a commodity and a variable) included in the resource.

___comparabilityTime.description: Extent to which data are comparable or reconcilable over time. It refers to the degree of comparability between the measures of a time series (e.g. related to a country, a commodity and a variable) included in the resource.
___comparabilityTime.title: Time comparability

description_i18n.en: General estimate of the extent to which data are consistent within the resource.

___coherenceIntern.description: General estimate of the extent to which data are consistent within the resource.
___coherenceIntern.title: Internal coherence

description_i18n.en: Degree of data comparability across the geographic areas or regions referenced by the resource. Data might be derived from surveys that in general are conducted by different statistical agencies. These surveys often refer to populations of different geographical areas, sometimes based on different methodologies.

___comparabilityGeographical.description: Degree of data comparability across the geographic areas or regions referenced by the resource. Data might be derived from surveys that in general are conducted by different statistical agencies. These surveys often refer to populations of different geographical areas, sometimes based on different methodologies.
___comparabilityGeographical.title: Geographic comparability

description_i18n.en: This section reports details about data distribution and sharing mechanisms. It includes information on conditions and formal agreements under which statistical information can be obtained. In addition it provides details on available options to obtain a resource, such as user accessibility to data and dissemination periodicity.

___meAccessibility.description: This section reports details about data distribution and sharing mechanisms. In addition it provides details on available options to obtain a resource, such as user accessibility to data and dissemination periodicity.

___seDistribution.title: Distribution

title_i18n.fr: Lien vers la ressource en ligne

description_i18n.en: Link to the on-line resource. It is conditional to the policy governing distribution and sharing mechanism. For 'restricted' resources it is not available.

___onlineResource.description: Link to the on-line resource. It is conditional to the policy governing distribution and sharing mechanism. For 'restricted' resources it is not available.
___onlineResource.title: Link to the on-line resource

description_i18n.en: Formats available for downloading the resources (e.g. excel, csv, pdf, etc.). . . It is conditional to the policy governing distribution and sharing mechanism. For 'restricted' resources it is not available.

description_i18n.en: This section gives information about the availability of additional information (documentation, further metadata. . . ) linked to the resource.

___seClarity.title: Clarity

description_i18n.en: Extent to which easily comprehensible metadata are available. It indicates whether a resource is accompanied by appropriate metadata and other relevant documentation.

___clarity.description: Extent to which easily comprehensible metadata are available. It indicates whether a resource is accompanied by appropriate metadata and other relevant documentation.
___clarity.title: Clarity

description_i18n.en: The percentage of completeness of metadata offers a numerical evaluation of the extent to which the resource is documented.

___metadataCompletenessRate.description: The percentage of completeness of metadata offers a numerical evaluation of the extent to which the resource is documented.
___metadataCompletenessRate.title: Metadata completeness rate

description_i18n.en: This section information on the level of confidentiality and the applied policy for releasing the resource. This metadata sub-entity concerns legislation (or any other formal provision) related to statistical confidentiality applied to the resource as well as the actual confidentiality data treatment applied (also with regard to the aggregated data disseminated).

___seConfidentiality.description: This section information on the level of confidentiality and the applied policy for releasing the resource. This metadata sub-entity concerns legislation (or any other formal provision) related to statistical confidentiality applied to the resource as well as the actual confidentiality data treatment applied (also with regard to the aggregated data disseminated).
___seConfidentiality.title: Confidentiality

description_i18n.en: Rules applied for treating the resource to ensure confidentiality and prevent unauthorized disclosure.

___confidentialityDataTreatment.description: Rules applied for treating the resource to ensure confidentiality and prevent unauthorized disclosure.
___confidentialityDataTreatment.title: Confidentiality - Data treatment

description_i18n.en: Legislative measures or other formal procedures which prevent unauthorized disclosure of data that identify a person or economic entity either directly or indirectly. It consists in textual description and references to legislation or other rules related to statistical confidentiality.

___confidentialityPolicy.description: Legislative measures or other formal procedures which prevent unauthorized disclosure of data that identify a person or economic entity either directly or indirectly. It consists in textual description and references to legislation or other rules related to statistical confidentiality.
___confidentialityPolicy.title: Confidentiality - Policy

description_i18n.en: Coded information describing the degree of confidentiality of the resource.

___confidentialityStatus.description: Coded information describing the degree of confidentiality of the resource.
___confidentialityStatus.title: Status of confidentiality

title_i18n.es: Versión de los estándares de metadatos

description_i18n.en: Version of the metadata standard specifications used.

___metadataStandardVersion.description: Version of the metadata standard specifications used.
___metadataStandardVersion.title: Version of metadata standard

description_i18n.en: Comments and additional details about the language used for the textual information of the resource. This field is addressed to highlight some particular inconsistencies in the language (or languages) used in the resource, if any. For example to alert that the resource is not completely homogeneous in the language used for textual information. Otherwise it can be leaved empty.

___languageDetails.description: Comments and additional details about the language used for the textual information of the resource. This field is addressed to highlight some particular inconsistencies in the language (or languages) used in the resource, if any. For example to alert that the resource is not completely homogeneous in the language used for textual information. Otherwise it can be leaved empty.
___languageDetails.title: Language details

description_i18n.en: This is the version of the metadata.

___version.description: This is the version of the metadata.
___version.title: Version

description_i18n.en: Resource identifier. It is a code that creates the match between the resource and the metadata it is associated to.

___uid.description: Resource identifier. It is a code that creates the match between the resource and the metadata it is associated to.
___uid.title: Resource identification code

description_i18n.en: Creation date of the resource.
This section includes a summary of the content of the resource and the description of the geographical, time and sector coverage.

___meContent.description: This section includes a summary of the content of the resource and the description of the geographical, time and sector coverage.
___meContent.title: CONTENT

description_i18n.en: Overview of the main characteristics of the resource and summary of the information contained in the resource, in an easily understandable manner, for technical and non-technical users.

___description.description: Overview of the main characteristics of the resource and summary of the information contained in the resource, in an easily understandable manner, for technical and non-technical users.
___description.title: Abstract

description_i18n.en: Size and extent of the resource. The term 'coverage' encompasses the descriptions of key dimensions delimiting the data, e.g. geographical, institutional, product, economic sector,etc., as well as relevant exceptions and exclusions.

___seCoverage.description: Size and extent of the resource. The term 'coverage' encompasses the descriptions of key dimensions delimiting the data, e.g. geographical, institutional, product, economic sector,etc., as well as relevant exceptions and exclusions.
___seCoverage.title: Coverage

description_i18n.en: Geographical coverage represented by the resource. It is highly recommended to make reference to officially recognized or easily identifiable macro-areas (e.g. South Saharan Africa, North America, OECD member countries..).

___coverageGeographic.description: Geographical coverage represented by the resource. It is highly recommended to make reference to officially recognized or easily identifiable macro-areas (e.g. South Saharan Africa, North America, OECD member countries..).
___coverageGeographic.title: Geographic extent

description_i18n.en: Sector(s) the resource refers to as specified in the selected codelist. The word 'Sector' indicates the subject area the resource refers to. These sectors can be institutional sectors, economic or other sectors (e.g. local government sector, agriculture, forestry, business services, etc.).

___coverageSectors.description: Sector(s) the resource refers to as specified in the selected codelist. The word 'Sector' indicates the subject area the resource refers to. These sectors can be institutional sectors, economic or other sectors (e.g. local government sector, agriculture, forestry, business services, etc.).
___coverageSectors.title: Main sector(s) (coded)

description_i18n.en: Information about the time period for which data are available. It requests to report the time window of reference (reporting the starting date and the ending date) even if it presents some lacks.
End point of time delimiting a time interval.

___to.description: End point of time delimiting a time interval.
___to.title: Date to

description_i18n.en: Start point of time delimiting a time interval.

___from.description: Start point of time delimiting a time interval.
___from.title: Date from

___coverageTime.description: Information about the time period for which data are available. It requests to report the time window of reference (reporting the starting date and the ending date) even if it presents some lacks.
___coverageTime.title: Coverage period

description_i18n.en: Textual element delimiting the statistical results with regard to the main sectors covered.

___coverageSectorsDetails.description: Textual element delimiting the statistical results with regard to the main sectors covered.
___coverageSectorsDetails.title: Main sector(s)

description_i18n.en: Definitions of the statistical concepts under measure (i.e. the statistical domain) and the main variables provided. The considered types of variables (e.g. raw figures, annual growth rates, index, ow or stock data, ...) should be defined and described in accordance with internationally accepted statistical standards, guidelines, or good practices.

___statisticalConceptsDefinitions.description: Definitions of the statistical concepts under measure (i.e. the statistical domain) and the main variables provided. The considered types of variables (e.g. raw figures, annual growth rates, index, ow or stock data, ...) should be defined and described in accordance with internationally accepted statistical standards, guidelines, or good practices.
___statisticalConceptsDefinitions.title: Statistical concepts / definitions

description_i18n.en: Information about the statistical population the resource refers to.

___seReferencePopulation.description: Information about the statistical population the resource refers to.
___seReferencePopulation.title: Reference population

description_i18n.en: Simplest unit for which information is sought and for which statistics are ultimately compiled.

___statisticalUnit.description: Simplest unit for which information is sought and for which statistics are ultimately compiled.
___statisticalUnit.title: Statistical unit

description_i18n.en: Specific time periods (e.g. a day, a week, a month, a fiscal year, a calendar year or several calendar years) the statistical variables refer to.

___referencePeriod.description: Specific time periods (e.g. a day, a week, a month, a fiscal year, a calendar year or several calendar years) the statistical variables refer to.
___referencePeriod.title: Period of reference

description_i18n.en: Type of geographical units the resource represents or refers to. Note that the spatial resolution must refer to the minimum mapping unit whose bounds are officially recognized indipendently from the measurement process of the phonomenon taken into account. Examples are: countries, administrative level 2, etc.

___referenceArea.description: Type of geographical units the resource represents or refers to. Note that the spatial resolution must refer to the minimum mapping unit whose bounds are officially recognized indipendently from the measurement process of the phonomenon taken into account. Examples are: countries, administrative level 2, etc.
___referenceArea.title: Area of reference

description_i18n.en: Target statistical population (one or more) the resource refers to.

___statisticalPopulation.description: Target statistical population (one or more) the resource refers to.
___statisticalPopulation.title: Statistical population

description_i18n.en: Commonly used word(s), formalized word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the resource.

___keywords.description: Commonly used word(s), formalized word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the resource.
___keywords.title: Keywords

description_i18n.en: Typology of the resource the metadata refers to. This metadata element determines whether certain meta-data entities are, or are not applicable. For example, the metadata entities 'SpatialRepresentation' and 'ReferenceSystem' are only available for geospatial resource types (e.g. raster; vector).

___resourceRepresentationType.description: Typology of the resource the metadata refers to. This metadata element determines whether certain meta-data entities are, or are not applicable. For example, the metadata entities 'SpatialRepresentation' and 'ReferenceSystem' are only available for geospatial resource types (e.g. raster; vector).
___resourceRepresentationType.title: Type of resource

description_i18n.en: This section allows to report information specifically addressed to resources of the kind 'codelist'.

___seCodeList.description: This section allows to report information specifically addressed to resources of the kind 'codelist'.
___seCodeList.title: Codelist

description_i18n.en: Hierarchical codelists may have several levels, information about the number of levels must be reported in order to describe the hierchy of the codelist.

___numberOfLevels.description: Hierarchical codelists may have several levels, information about the number of levels must be reported in order to describe the hierchy of the codelist.
___numberOfLevels.title: Number of levels

description_i18n.en: Codelist typology. A codelist can be a simple objects basically composed by a list of couples of code and label or a more complex object whose elements present some hierarchical relationships.

___typeOfCodeList.description: Codelist typology. A codelist can be a simple objects basically composed by a list of couples of code and label or a more complex object whose elements present some hierarchical relationships.
___typeOfCodeList.title: Type of codelist

description_i18n.en: This section lists values and metadata of the dimensions of the resource. In a data table, dimensions may refer to geographical areas, time, commodities, gender, etc. . . It includes iterative elements representing 'n' dimensions and 'm' elements of each dimension. In addition ResourceRecord allows to report information at single-value level.

___meResourceStructure.description: This section lists values and metadata of the dimensions of the resource. In a data table, dimensions may refer to geographical areas, time, commodities, gender, etc. . . It includes iterative elements representing 'n' dimensions and 'm' elements of each dimension. In addition ResourceRecord allows to report information at single-value level.
___meResourceStructure.title: RESOURCE STRUCTURE

description_i18n.en: Information at a sigle recod level.

___seResourceRecords.description: Information at a sigle recod level.
___seResourceRecords.title: Resource Records

description_i18n.en: Information on the type and content of the dimensions of the dataset.

___seResourceDimensions.description: Information on the type and content of the dimensions of the dataset.
___seResourceDimensions.title: Resource Dimentions

description_i18n.en: Identifier of the metadata record to which this metadata record is a subset of (i.e. parent metadata of hierarchical metadata records). The specification of the parentIdentifier allows to inherit a set of metadata information from the parent metadata record. The choice of which metadata elements must to be kept from the parent record and the one that has to be manually modified, it is subject to ad hoc controls.

___parentIdentifiers.description: Identifier of the metadata record to which this metadata record is a subset of (i.e. parent metadata of hierarchical metadata records). The specification of the parentIdentifier allows to inherit a set of metadata information from the parent metadata record. The choice of which metadata elements must to be kept from the parent record and the one that has to be manually modified, it is subject to ad hoc controls.
___parentIdentifiers.title: Parent(s) metadata ID

description_i18n.en: Value assigned to the cells to represent the absence of data. Missing values are usually highlight through apposite ags, however the data matrix does not report empty cells but a predefined combination of characters (such as 'NA', '000' . . . ) indicating the absence of data.

___noDataValue.description: Value assigned to the cells to represent the absence of data. Missing values are usually highlight through apposite ags, however the data matrix does not report empty cells but a predefined combination of characters (such as 'NA', '000' . . . ) indicating the absence of data.
___noDataValue.title: Value assigned to No-data
